result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Exhibits in Support of Supplemental Postconviction Motion filed by Atty Lohr
Defendant's Supplemental Postconviction Motion/Motion to Reconsider Denial of Postconviction Motion filed by Atty Lohr

It is ordered thst this Corrt retains jurisdiction over this appeal and remands for the appellant to file a supplemental postconviction motion.  The motion shall be filed by October 31, 2022.  It is ordered that the circuit court shall hold any necessary proceedings and enter an order deciding the supplemental postconviction motion within ninety days of the filing of the motion.  It is ordered that a transcript of any hearing on the supplemental postconviction motion, if necessary for this appeal, shall be requested within eleven days of the entry of the order disposing of the motion.  The transcript shall be filed within thirty days of the date requested, and the party requesting the transcript shall advise the court reporter of this deadline.  It is ordered that the record shall be transmitted back to this court within five days of entry of the order disposing of the supplemental postconviction motion or the filing of the transcript if requested.  The record shall include the proceedings on remand.  It is ordered that the time to file the appellant's brief is extended to forty days after the return of the record to this court.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.
Ct. 1 12 years initial confinement, consecutive to any other sentence, 3 years extended supervision. Ct. 2 1 year initial confinement, concurrent with Ct. 1, 6 months extended supervision.
Exhibit #1 - Copy of JOC from Milwaukee County case no:  97CF974862  - stored in 2016 Criminal Files Exhibit Box

11:11 AM Defendant Luis A Ramirez  #244212 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State filed a copy of the JOC from defendants conviction in the Milwaukee County case. Victim made a statement. Sentencing recommendations argued. Defendant made a statement to the Court. Court sentenced the defendant on Ct. 1 to serve 15 years in prison, consecutive to any other sentence. 12 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. $518.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. Ct. 2 Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1.5 years in prison, concurrent to Ct. 1; 1 year initial confinement and 6 months extended supervison, concurrent to Ct. 1. $243.00 costs. No contact with the victim of this case. No jail credit. Defendant requested his glasses be returned to him. Atty Benavides will follow up on the glasses. Defendant is not eligible for the challenge incarceration program or substance abuse program. 11:55 AM
To: Green Bay Correctional

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA Brenda Yaskal, regarding jury issue.
Sentencing hearing on February 24, 2020 at 11:00 am.
Verdict forms :  2 signed - Guilty; 2 unsigned - Not Guilty.
#3 Calendar for Year 2015
Exhibits 1 - 3 stored in 2016 Criminal Files Exhibit Box

2nd day of trial - 09:00 AM Defendant Luis A Ramirez  #244212 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion on procedure.  9:04 Jurors returned to courtroom. State called witness B. Slaney, former CCI officer; sworn. Direct examination. Cross examination. Redirect. Recross. Witness excused. 9:32 State called witness Z. Graff, CCI officer; sworn.  Direct examination. Cross examination.  Witness excused. 9:38 State called witness P. Hooper, former CCI officer; sworn.  Direct. Cross.  Witness excused. State rested. 9:44 Jurors removed.  Atty Benavides motioned for dismissal based on evidence. State had no position. Court found no basis for the motion. Motion denied. Court reviewed rights to testify with defendant.  Court in recess 9:53/10:14 Court resumed, appearances the same. Jurors returned.  Defense called witness, defendant Ramirez; sworn. Direct examination. Exhibit # 3 marked, offered & received.  Exhibit #2 offered and received. Direct continued. Cross examination.  Witness excused. 10:53 Jurors removed.  Proposed jury instructions and verdict forms discussed.  Court to be present by 12:45; Court in recess 11:27/12:55 Court resumed, appearances the same. Court and counsel reviewed jury instructions. 1:21 Jurors returned; alternate Juror drawn. Court read jury instructions. 1:42 Closing statements by counsel 2:21 Court read final jury instructions and review verdict forms with jury.  Bailiffs sworn.  2:25 Jurors removed to deliberate. Court in recess 2:28/3:12 Court resumed; appearances the same.  Jurors returned.  Guilty verdict on count 1 - Battery by Prisoner with the use of a dangerous weapon & Guilty on count 2, Disorderly Conduct without the use of a dangerous weapon.  Jury polled and released.  DA Yaskal motioned for judgment on verdicts, motion granted, Judgment entered. Sentencing to be set for a separate hearing.
Court adjourned 3:30
#1 Pencil in brown bag (stored in evidence box).
#2  Offender Telephone Call Tracking Log
33 jurors summoned; 30 appeared; 23 seated for voir dire; no jurors excused for cause; 13 jurors seated and sworn.

1st day of trial - 09:01AM  Defendant Luis A Ramirez in court, in custody, with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.   DA Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury not present. Motions in limine discussed. Court in recess 9:55/10:23  Court resumed; appearances the same; potential jurors present and sworn. 23 jurors seated for voir dire; Court questioned jurors. 10:45  Counsel questioned jurors; peremptory strikes-5 each; 13 jurors selected and sworn; prospective jurors released.  Jurors removed. Sidebar discussed. Court in recess. 11:28/11:55  Court resumed; appearances the same; Court gave add'l jury instructions. Court in recess 12:05/1:11 Court resumed. Appearances the same. DA Yaskal stated the information charges as repeater and use of dangerous weapon, questioned the jury instructions. Agreement reached on how to proceed. 1:17 Jurors returned.  Opening arguments by counsel.  1:24 State called witness T. Judd, sworn.  Direct examination. 2:04 Cross examination. Exhibit #2 marked, witness unable to identify Exhibit #2, State objected to the use of the document, Court granted objection.  Cross continued. Redirect. Exhibit #1 marked. Witness excused.  Exhibit #1 offered & receivded.  2:25 State called witness M. Biedermann, ER Dr. at DHS; sworn.  Direct. Cross. Redirect. Recross. Witness excused. 2:36 State called witness E. Starck, nurse; sworn. Direct. Cross.  Witness excused. 2:48 State called witness, T. Anderson, nurse, sworn. Direct. Cross.  Witness excused. 3:00 Jurors removed; Court in recess 3:00/3:15 Court resumed. Appearances the same. Jurors returned.  3:20 State called witness M. Babcock, CCI officer; sworn. Direct. Cross.  Witness excused. 3:43 State called witness S. Darling-Jezyt, CCI officer; sworn.  Direct. Cross. Redirect. 4:09 Witness excused. Court excused jurors until 8:45 am tomorrow.  Court will resume tomorrow at 9:00 am.  Court in recess 4:13 pm.
